subject: Productivity
title: Identity-Based Habits
description: Learn Identity-Based Habits in one minute.

hook.text: Two people refuse a cigarette. One says I'm trying to quit. The other says I'm not a smoker.

buildup.text: James Clear argues the deepest habit change happens at the identity level, not the behavior level.

discovery.text: When a habit becomes part of who you are, motivation is no longer needed. You just act like yourself.

twist.text: Most people set outcome goals. Identity goals are more powerful: become the type of person who runs.

climax.text: Every action is a vote for the person you want to become. Habits are the ballot.

punchline.text: Change your identity. The habits follow.

quiz.question: According to James Clear, where does the deepest habit change happen?
